comments.commentBody:
What's with you folks and endings? Mr. Cohen did not know why he helped the man steal stand, or what became of the sand, or what had become of his summer of writing on Coney Island. He just wrote, and shoveled, and in his effort and brief connection, "broke with the cold."

Do you need them to move in together?

If that is Newt's thinking on the issue, what is to stop a President Gingrich from simply issuing a Presidential pardon to all the illegals that he decides should stay in the country? Don't count on an idea like that not occurring to him.

I am also troubled by making membership in a local church a criterion for eligibility to stay. Quite apart from the issue of government endorsement of religion, it grants to local church authorities power to decide which illegals get a chance to stay and which do not, since membership in a local church is up to them.

This news story says McCain sponsoring the comprhensive immigration legislation in 2007 dogged him throughout the campaign and caused it to almost "collapse".  Yet if I recall, Senator McCain won the GOP nomination in 2008.  Typical skewed reporting in the NYT.
Zero pay jobs don't stimulate the economy.

What a humanist! Compassionate conservative, that is, except when he happens to be giving one of his wives the bad news. Besides any word out of Newt's mouth is just the latest expedient lie, including and, if and but.

Obviously we can expect precisely nothing from the administrators of our hopelessly failed social contract to deal with being rendered permanently surplus to the workforce:

http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/25/opinion/the-age-of-the-superfluous-wor...

Mr. Gingrich is an oxymoron among conservatives – a man presenting himself as intelligent. As I have posted many times before there is a difference between politics and legislating, and the race for the nomination is politics at its heart. The art of politics is torturing the facts to appeal to a group of supporters and gain enough votes to win an election. This is the motivation behind Mr. Gingrich’s stated policy on immigration.

The difference between a manager and a leader is the former does things right and the latter does the right thing. Political leadership is the art of getting support for the right thing, and does not of necessity mean one needs to torture facts to make a point. It is the identification of policy for the greater good that resonates with and attracts rational voters; it is identification with policy that does not need to be spun to make it appealing.

The irrational base plied with fears of the other the conservative movement has cultivated for so long will not like to hear this appeal to rational policy. The irrational base will come out to vote because they will vote against President Obama regardless of who the conservatives nominate. It will be interesting to see how Mr. Gingrich’s immigration policy pronouncement, which is quite similar to the Obama administration’s implemented policy on Latinos, will play out in the battle for the hearts and minds of conservatives. My guess is one sane policy pronouncement will not make Mr. Gingrich’s nomination because he will eventually walk it back like the rest of his flirtations with rational policy. His audience will not stand for a policy that is the same as Mr. Obama’s. This is why the conservative nomination process is characterized by anti-Obama venom and no real viable policy statements.
Newt Gingrich is one of the most manipulative, opportunistic, and deceitful persons who has ever graced the political scene.  His status among Republicans tell us a great deal about his party.
Did Fox News and Rush tell their viewers to rush right over the "The Caucus" and start their hate mongering?  So refreshing to read slurs and trash.  Thought for a minute I was reading on Yahoo.

Most of these comments are a laugh.  This man has tried hard and is doing his best which is more than W. Bush ever did or could.  The KKK is still very much kicking in this country and it shows when you read most of the comments.  Ignorance in all things is our new mode.  Nobody thinks anymore.

John Kerry is overated, most of all by himself.  As a legislator, he's never been what you'd call a font of new ideas in the past, and he isn't one now.  As chairman of the Senate Foreign relations Committee, he knows everybody but influences nobody.  Why would he beocme Secretary of State?  What would he bring to the party?
You knew the Democrats were fixing to lose the election when they ran Kerry for president. What a stiff.

Is that the same Senator Kerry, who as the Democratic candidate for President in 2004, had Ohio and the Election stolen from him by then Ohio Secretary of State Ken Blackwell and his inside connections to DIEBOLD?

"Success Eludes Him" will apply to Mitt Romney after the Attorney General in MA opens the investigation into Mitt violating the Public Records Law by ordering the destruction of the volumes of e-mails and other records from his failed days as Governor.

How DARE Newt Gingrich propose something that isn't draconian or cruel? He should know better. Just one person saying the phrase "amnesty for illegals" causes the Tea Party wing of the Republican party to start reflexively frothing at the mouth. What Newt should have said was "we should build a triple border fence with cannons that shoot pepper spray to keep them illegals out."

Mr. Salinger wrote about seeing God in everything and in an everyday language. As a teen, I loved The Catcher in the Rye, but as an adult it became more about the short stories and Franny and Zooey.  Franny and Zooey is an adult answer to his complaints about those annoying phonies, he starts to see Jesus Christ in everyone, even those he despises.  He is teaching buddist lessons through very American parables.  Love him and always will...
Hate it? Who could have hated it? Charming, eccentric, and even self-explanatory--a control tower--it was the perfect transportation icon.
The new tower has all the character of a suburban municipal water tank.  Perhaps even less.

My sadness at the demolition of the "swisscheese" tower comes not from regret at the loss of an archtectural ikon but from the realization of my own mortality.  I've lived all of my nearly 57 years in Flushing and have now seen the demolition of several monumental structures (Shea Stadium, several terminals at JFK) that I witnessed being built.  My dad was a civil engineer and regularly took me to the airports long before I ever got on a plane.  I hope that I, at least, will be allowed to grow old gracefully.

The tab from Occupy movements in cities nationwide is estimated to be at least $13 million in police overtime and municipal services. Why, that’s about as much as Freddie and Fannie planned to pay in executive compensation this year! [AP, NPR]

Another brain dead article from the Times. The snark element made me laugh, so stupid. NY would be better off spending money sending the upper police command back to school after they made pretty much every mistake possible, or maybe they are just not teachable. They'l almost certainly be videoed paper spraying another old lady next week.

Either the manager of the supermarket I spoke to the other day listened to what I was saying, or he reads the City Room.
The loud speaker today was turned down so low I really had to strain to hear what Christmas song was being played.
HO, Ho, Ho!

I just heard that the musuem will now be delayed at least a year after completion.  However, this is not something new to a person such as myself who has been keeping tabs on this entire process.  By no surprise, the delay is because of cost, which has been the issue for much of this.  It just goes to show that it was better idea to have the Twin Towers rebuilt instead.

I got ONE parking ticket in the Bronx several years ago. It was an expensive lesson but one I took to heart. Now I read EVERY sign on the block. Then I read them again. Then I try to figure out if they're saying something other than what I think they're saying. I've put money in the meter on Christmas Day. Still not sure if I had to but buying peace of mind for a few quarters is a real bargain.

I think most of us have a call-center horror story to relate; most, I'm sure, involving----and I hate to have to say this----a call to India.

I once spent over an hour trying to solve a problem with my computer. And I'm positive that half that time was spent saying----in a half-shout because the line was so bad-----"Could you REPEAT that, please?!", and, "I'm sorry, I didn't get that, could you please SPELL that?!".

Now the Phillipines. At least we're inching closer to American shores.
It seems all the business is moving towards East Asia these days: China, Hong Kong, Korea, Taiwan, Singapore, Vietnam, and now the Philippines.
